method: Grease tin (bread) or baking tray (rolls) with oil.
Mix the flour, salt and yeast in a bowl. Add the oil and water. Stir to form a soft dough.
Knead on a floured surface for 5-7 minutes until smooth. Place in an oiled bowl, cover loosely in a plastic bag and leave in a warm place.
Once the dough has risen to double its original size (~1 hr), knead again until smooth.

Shape dough into loaf and place in tin (for rolls, shape into 8 rolls and place on baking tray). Leave in a warm place to rise (again loosely covered in a plastic bag) for another half an hour. During rising, preheat oven to 200Â°C / gas mark 7.
Bake in oven for 15-20 minutes, until golden brown. Remove the loaf from tin and leave to cool on a wire rack.
